intro: Mostuea angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf spiderwort, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It features slender, upright stems with lance-shaped leaves that are typically 2–4 inches long. The plant produces striking blue to purple flowers in late spring to early summer, which are borne on long, slender pedicels. Its botanical structure includes fibrous roots and a basal rosette of leaves, typical of many members of the Asphodelaceae family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
